result.execSummary:
On one or more charges in this case, Peter P. Schoepp was found not guilty by reason of mental disease or defect. The defendant was found guilty of actually committing the crime(s) charged, but was also found not to be legally responsible under Wis. Stats. 971.165 for committing the crime(s) because of the defendant's mental condition. The legal effect of a finding of not guilty by reason of mental disease or defect is that the court must commit the defendant to the custody of the Department of Health and Family Services.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

**sent to judge for review**
on Petition to Revoke Conditional Release
for Placement

Defendant Peter P. Schoepp in court, in custody.  Matthew C. Allen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  SPD was unable to appoint attorney prior to today's hearing.  Defendant wishes to proceed today without counsel and will not waive time limits for this hearing.  Court advises defendant of his/her right to counsel - colloquy given.  Defendant freely, willingly, knowledgeably and intelligently waives his/her right to counsel, and wishes to proceed unrepresented.  Court reviews right to attorney waiver with defendant.  The Court deems the defendant competent to proceed pro se.  Court makes record of current case status and report of conditional release.  Atty Allen calls Jessica Olson, LSS caseworker, as witness via phone, sworn and testified.  Ex 1 - CR Adjustment Summary, o/r.  Cross examination.  Atty Allen calls DOC Agent Josh Statz as witness via phone, sworn and testified.  Ex 2 - DOC letter, o/r.  Cross examination.  Defendant sworn and testified.  Ex 3 - LSS Report, o/r.  Argument by ADA Allen; No further argument from defendant.  Court states findings of fact, conclusions of law and orders:   There is clear, satisfactory & convincing evidence that Mr. Schoepp violated the conditions.  Based on the findings, the Court orders conditional release be revoked and remands defendant under Sec. 51.37(3) until expiration of the sentence or until another conditional release is ordered.  Defendant remanded to a facility designated by the Dept. of Health Services.

Supervised release revocation hearing on August 30, 2018 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Peter P. Schoepp in court with attorney Mark Walter Frank.  Defendant Peter P. Schoepp in custody.   Matthew C. Allen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court makes record of case history and status.  Request has been filed for revocation of conditional release.  Defendant does contest the revocation of his conditional release.  Defendant also is requesting removal of counsel and appointment of new counsel prior to the revocation hearing.  Motion to withdraw as counsel made, no objection by any party.  Court grants motion for Atty Frank to withdraw based on good cause.  Defendant will need to apply to the SPD for new counsel.  Defendant advises to the Court that he wishes to represent himself instead of waiving time limits for hearing.  Atty Allen does have concern on self representation.  Court contacts SPD for instruction and bailiff will assist defendant in contacting SPD.  Defendant will waive time limits for a short extension.  Supervised release revocation hearing scheduled for August 30, 2018 at 08:30 am.

Supervised release hearing on January 12, 2018 at 11:30 am.

Attorney Mark Walter Frank in court for Defendant Peter P. Schoepp. Prosecuting Atty Matthew C. Allen appeared for State of Wisconsin. Defendant Peter P. Schoepp in court in custody.  2 cases called 14CF124 and 14CF126.  Court recounts file - counsel both have received a copy Dr. Berney's report and SW Bartles report. Court summarizes Dr. Berney's report (Ex. 1)   .Court summarizes Social Worker Bartles (Ex. 2).  No corrections provided to the Corut by either counsel.  Attorney fRank supplements the summary with quotes from Dr. Berney.  Ex. 1 and 2 are admitted.  State addresses the Court - based on report Allen feels he could not show clear and convincing evidence to the contrary of conditional release, and requests conditional release plan be signed, plan to be provided within 60 dya, and that hearing date be set within 60 days for hearing.  Frank concurs, and asks for early hearing date.  Court states findings, clear & convincing evidence that conditional release will be needed at this time.  Court orders DHS to prepoare a conditional release plan within 60 days.  Hearing set for 1/12/2018 AT 11:30.If the plan comes in earlier, the court may move the hearing sooner.  Supervised release hearing scheduled for January 12, 2018 at 11:30 am.
